page.title: 20Mannington Village
page.content: Mannington-A Village? This was the only area in our block apart from farms where there was any collection of buildings. However we did not find here a village of any great size,nor had it unlike other villages been much bigger in the last century. The village was largely spread along the length of one road known as Burt's Lane, this was not a major route,but it joined busier routes at it's N&S junctions-even the pub was not in the centre of the village! It is likely that the village provided some services for the very scattered smallholdings and farms, some of the buildings still show there former use, The Old Posthouse, The Old Schoolhouse and the converted General Stores.Today the village is a mixture of small farms,houses & stables.
